text: This is a lists of tropical cyclones that affected the Philippines in 2022. ==Tropical Cyclone Names== This season, PAGASA will use its own naming scheme for tropical cyclones that either develop within or move into their self-defined area of responsibility. The names were taken from a list of names last used during 2018 and are scheduled to be used again during 2026. All of the names are the same except Obet and Rosita, replacing the names Ompong and Rosita after these were retired. ===Used Tropical Cyclone Names=== * Agaton * Basyang ===Unused Tropical Cyclone Names=== The unused tropical cyclone names is the names of the following Caloy, Domeng, Ester, Florita, Gardo, Henry, Inday, Josie, Karding, Luis, Maymay, Neneng, Obet, Paeng, Queenie, Rosal, Samuel and Tomas ==Season effects== This table summarizes all the systems that developed within or moved into the Philippines, to the west of the International Date Line during 2022. The tables also provide a brief summary of a systems intensity, duration, land areas affected and any deaths or damages associated with the system. |- | Agaton (Megi) || || bgcolor=#| || bgcolor=#| || bgcolor=#| || Eastern Visayas, Northern Mindanao, Davao Region || || || |- | Basyang (Malakas) || || bgcolor=#| || bgcolor=#| || bgcolor=#| ||Philippine Coast Guard (during on that time)|| || || ==References== Category:2022 in Asia Category:Tropical cyclones in Asia Category:Pacific tropical cyclones
title: Tropical cyclones that affected the Philippines in 2022
